It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in early spring. The plant is native to specific regions in eastern North America, where it thrives in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
